FacilityName: Fox River Water Pollution Control Center
DeregistrationReasonOtherText: All Chlorine and Sulfur Dioxide gas was removed from the facility

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICY:  The Fox River Water Pollution Control Center is committed to promoting a safe operating environment for the facility, its employees, and the surrounding community.

FACILITY DESCRIPTION AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES:  The Fox River Water Pollution Control Center is located at 21225 Enterprise Drive, Brookfield, Wisconsin 53045. The facility has many distinct processes that treat wastewater prior to discharge to the Fox River. One process, the chlorination process, utilizes a chemical regulated by EPA's Risk Management Program Rule: chlorine. The chlorination process adds chlorine gas to wastewater to reduce bacteria. Chlorine is received in ton containers. The chlorine process has a dedicated storage and process area. These process areas have been designed in accordance with all local, state, and federal codes. The chlorination process has a gas detection / warning system, providing an alarm should concentration of chlorine exceed 1 part per million. The chlorine process is maintained and operated by personnel certified by the State of Wisconsin as Wastewater Treatment Plant Operators. 

SPECIAL NOTE: The chlorination process is operated ONLY from May 1 through October 31. During this period, a maximum of two one-ton containers of chlorine are present. During the period November 1 through April 31, the chlorine inventory is minimized, and is below the RMP threshold quantity. Hence, PREDICTIVE FILING has been indicated in this Risk Management Plan. 

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM: The facility maintains a compliance program to meet the requirements of 29 CFR 1910.119, "Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals" for the chlorination process.  Compliance with this regulation and EPA's "Risk Management Program Rule" helps prevent the release of chlorine. Additionally, these regulations required development of procedures to minimize releases of chlorine in the event that they do occur, and to

outline appropriate emergency response steps to take in the event of a release.

FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:  There have been no accidents or injuries associated with the chlorination process for the previous five years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM: The Fox River Water Pollution Control Center emergency response program is based upon the OSHA requirements for Emergency Action Plans. The plan is coordinated with the City of Brookfield, Wisconsin Fire Department.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:  The facility personnel continually review the plant processes for improvements in safety, quality, and performance, and, the facility is periodically inspected by regulatory agencies for compliance with permit and regulatory requirements. Input from these sources is addressed as quickly as possible.
